body: Is your dog's stomach hard? Here's why. I had been feeding my dog Blue Buffalo for years and every now and then my pup would have digestion issues. It got to the point where he would hack, whine, and not eat because he wasn't feeling well. I couldn't pick him up without a yelp and my usual spunky pup would hardly get up to pee. I called the vet and took him in. The first question they asked was, "Is your dog eating Blue Buffalo dry food?" I replied, "Yes?" They told me that they get several cases like this in a year, where an owner will come in with a bloated dog that won't eat or move. They suggested I switch from Blue Buffalo to Royal Canin, which should cause the issues to stop. Within a couple of days, my pup was back to his normal self and hasn't had any digestion issues ever since. I work with dogs for a living and have told this information to several pet-owners who have since switched food brands and as a result, have much more comfortable pups.If you're feeding your dog this stuff, press on their stomach. Is it hard? Does your dog seem uncomfortable? If so, it might be time switch their food to something that is actually nutritious instead of this awful brand. My vet and I recommend Royal Canin.
